bind.h

00001 #ifndef _XENO_NUCLEUS_BIND_H
00002 #define _XENO_NUCLEUS_BIND_H
00003 
00004 #include <stdio.h>
00005 #include <stdlib.h>
00006 #include <string.h>
00007 #include <errno.h>
00008 #include <signal.h>
00009 #include <pthread.h>
00010 #include <asm/xenomai/syscall.h>
00011 
00012 __attribute__ ((weak))
00013 int xeno_sigxcpu_no_mlock = 1;
00014 
00015 static void xeno_handle_mlock_alert(int sig)
00016 {
00017         struct sigaction sa;
00018 
00019         if (xeno_sigxcpu_no_mlock) {
00020                 fprintf(stderr,
00021                         "Xenomai: process memory not locked (missing mlockall?)\n");
00022                 fflush(stderr);
00023                 exit(4);
00024         }
00025 
00026         /* XNTRAPSW was set for the thread but no user-defined handler
00027            has been set to override our internal handler, so let's
00028            invoke the default signal action. */
00029 
00030         sa.sa_handler = SIG_DFL;
00031         sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00032         sa.sa_flags = 0;
00033         sigaction(SIGXCPU, &sa, NULL);
00034         pthread_kill(pthread_self(), SIGXCPU);
00035 }
00036 
00037 static inline int
00038 xeno_bind_skin(unsigned skin_magic, const char *skin, const char *module)
00039 {
00040         struct sigaction sa;
00041         xnfeatinfo_t finfo;
00042         int muxid;
00043 
00044 #ifdef xeno_arch_features_check
00045         xeno_arch_features_check();
00046 #endif /* xeno_arch_features_check */
00047 
00048         muxid = XENOMAI_SYSBIND(skin_magic,
00049                                 XENOMAI_FEAT_DEP, XENOMAI_ABI_REV, &finfo);
00050         switch (muxid) {
00051         case -EINVAL:
00052 
00053                 fprintf(stderr, "Xenomai: incompatible feature set\n");
00054                 fprintf(stderr,
00055                         "(required=\"%s\", present=\"%s\", missing=\"%s\").\n",
00056                         finfo.feat_man_s, finfo.feat_all_s, finfo.feat_mis_s);
00057                 exit(1);
00058 
00059         case -ENOEXEC:
00060 
00061                 fprintf(stderr, "Xenomai: incompatible ABI revision level\n");
00062                 fprintf(stderr, "(needed=%lu, current=%lu).\n",
00063                         XENOMAI_ABI_REV, finfo.abirev);
00064                 exit(1);
00065 
00066         case -ENOSYS:
00067         case -ESRCH:
00068 
00069                 fprintf(stderr,
00070                         "Xenomai: %s skin or CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE disabled.\n"
00071                         "(modprobe %s?)\n", skin, module);
00072                 exit(1);
00073         }
00074 
00075         if (muxid < 0) {
00076                 fprintf(stderr, "Xenomai: binding failed: %s.\n",
00077                         strerror(-muxid));
00078                 exit(1);
00079         }
00080 
00081         /* Install a SIGXCPU handler to intercept alerts about unlocked
00082            process memory. */
00083 
00084         sa.sa_handler = &xeno_handle_mlock_alert;
00085         sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00086         sa.sa_flags = 0;
00087         sigaction(SIGXCPU, &sa, NULL);
00088 
00089         return __xn_mux_shifted_id(muxid);
00090 }
00091 
00092 static inline int
00093 xeno_bind_skin_opt(unsigned skin_magic, const char *skin, const char *module)
00094 {
00095         xnfeatinfo_t finfo;
00096         int muxid;
00097 
00098 #ifdef xeno_arch_features_check
00099         xeno_arch_features_check();
00100 #endif /* xeno_arch_features_check */
00101 
00102         muxid = XENOMAI_SYSBIND(skin_magic,
00103                                 XENOMAI_FEAT_DEP, XENOMAI_ABI_REV, &finfo);
00104         switch (muxid) {
00105         case -EINVAL:
00106 
00107                 fprintf(stderr, "Xenomai: incompatible feature set\n");
00108                 fprintf(stderr,
00109                         "(required=\"%s\", present=\"%s\", missing=\"%s\").\n",
00110                         finfo.feat_man_s, finfo.feat_all_s, finfo.feat_mis_s);
00111                 exit(1);
00112 
00113         case -ENOEXEC:
00114 
00115                 fprintf(stderr, "Xenomai: incompatible ABI revision level\n");
00116                 fprintf(stderr, "(needed=%lu, current=%lu).\n",
00117                         XENOMAI_ABI_REV, finfo.abirev);
00118                 exit(1);
00119 
00120         case -ENOSYS:
00121         case -ESRCH:
00122 
00123                 return -1;
00124         }
00125 
00126         if (muxid < 0) {
00127                 fprintf(stderr, "Xenomai: binding failed: %s.\n",
00128                         strerror(-muxid));
00129                 exit(1);
00130         }
00131 
00132         return __xn_mux_shifted_id(muxid);
00133 }
